participants: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: Hi team :wave: does anyone know what happened to Fetcher? Not seeing it as an App anymore
Confirming that I also don't see it on instabase.com (http://instabase.com)
I dont rememeber the last time I saw fetcher as an app…. I only remember as a step in Flow
Fetcher is not an independent app — rather something which is entirely configured and embedded within Flow @georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
it’s a capability within Instabase Flow — but we haven’t designed a special UI to configure it. Currently it is created using Text Editor to write the custom Python code that does the Fetch logic

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: Okay - we should try to better categorize what is an app vs feature as this is coming up with customers as a point of confusion. There are many things on this list that are not apps and our customer contracts reference many features as apps. https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1IwzyvLkhHAtBwr37ADSWtW2UFOqS4ikYgNArDsrG-2U (https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1IwzyvLkhHAtBwr37ADSWtW2UFOqS4ikYgNArDsrG-2U)
Yes — we should probably use the term Capability
a Capability is something that is a step in a Flow. The capability can either be configured via a User Interface like an App, or within Flow itself, as is the case with Fetcher
on top of that — there are standalone apps like Notebook, Text Editor, NLP Search, etc

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: I’ll take a shot at creating categories and sorting and ask for review! Thanks David!
absolutely — happy to take a look
